summary: This document is an email chain from February 2002 discussing social and recreational plans for an unnamed individual (likely Jeffrey Epstein) visiting Peru. The emails, involving 'G. Max' and 'Juan Estoban' (Juanesteban Ganoza), coordinate activities like horseback riding, visiting the Nazca Lines, and mention the provision of 'girls' for the visitor.

persons.name: G. Max
persons.context: Appears as the primary correspondent forwarding and discussing plans for an unnamed visitor's trip to Peru, coordinating with Juan Estoban.

persons.name: Juan Estoban
persons.context: Also identified as Juanesteban Ganoza. Provides detailed suggestions for the visitor's activities in Peru, including horseback riding, sightseeing, and comments on arranging 'girls'.

persons.name: Juanesteban Ganoza
persons.context: Full name of 'Juan Estoban'. Author of an email detailing potential Sunday activities for an unnamed visitor in Peru.

connections.description: Collaborating via email to plan social and recreational activities for an unnamed third-party visitor to Peru.

events.title: Email Planning Visitor's Peru Itinerary
events.description: Email exchange discussing potential Sunday activities for an unnamed visitor in Peru, including horseback riding, visiting the Nazca Lines, and arranging for 'girls'.

keyFacts: The emails discuss planning recreational activities for an unnamed visitor (implied to be Jeffrey Epstein) in Peru.
Activities proposed include riding Peruvian Paso horses, visiting the Nazca Lines, water-skiing in Paracas, and having private lunches.
The correspondence includes a direct reference to arranging 'girls' for the visitor, with Juan Estoban asking 'how old is he?' and stating 'I doubt it that he will find someone here, but we can try.'
The primary individuals involved are 'G. Max' and 'Juan Estoban' (Juanesteban Ganoza), who appear to be local associates facilitating the visit.
